message.content: Yes, the authors provided the estimated hourly wage paid to participants and the total amount spent on participant compensation. They mentioned that participants were compensated $1.4 for their time (∼ 5 − 8 min) and the cost of evaluating one method using their benchmark is relatively modest ($50 per test scenario).

Yes, the authors mention the estimated hourly wage paid to participants and the total amount spent on participant compensation. The participants were recruited using Amazon Mechanical Turk and were compensated $1.4 for their time, which took approximately 5-8 minutes. The total cost of evaluating one method using their benchmark is estimated to be $50 per test scenario.

Yes, the authors provide the estimated hourly wage paid to participants and the total amount spent on participant compensation. They mention that participants were compensated $1.4 for their time (∼ 5 − 8 min) using Amazon Mechanical Turk, and the overall cost of evaluating one method using their benchmark is relatively modest ($50 per test scenario).
